landing.contentText: Import data from QuickBooks Desktop to {{brandName}} and export expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop

preRequisite.configurationSubHeaderText: Begin your QuickBooks integration by completing the following steps.

connector.configurationSubHeaderText: Connect to QuickBooks Desktop by completing the following steps.
connector.subLabel: Expenses will be posted to the NetSuite tenant mapping selected here. Once configured, you can not change {{brandName}} organization or tenant mapping.

exportSetting.contentText: In this section, you can configure how and when the expenses from {{brandName}} need to be exported to QuickBooks Desktop.

reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseSubLabel: Enable this to export the reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any out-of-pocket expenses will not be exported to Quickbooks Desktop.
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseTypeLabel: How should the expenses be exported?
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseTypeSubLabel: Choose the type of transaction in QuickBooks Desktop to export your {{brandName}} expenses.
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseStateLabel: At which state should the expenses be ready to export from {{brandName}}?
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseStateSubLabel: You can export expenses either when they are awaiting payments after approval (processing) or when the payment has been settled (closed).
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseDateSubLabel: Expenses will be grouped and posted using the configured date when exporting from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseGroupLabel: How should the expenses be grouped?
reimbursable.reimbursableExpenseGroupSubLabel: Expenses can either be exported as single line items (expense) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (report)
reimbursable.employeeMappingLabel: How are your employees represented in QuickBooks Desktop?
reimbursable.employeeMappingSubLabel: Select how employees are represented in QuickBooks Desktop to ensure expenses from {{brandName}} export to the correct employee/vendor record.
reimbursable.autoMapEmployeesLabel: How should employees in {{brandName}} be mapped to
reimbursable.autoMapEmployeesSubLabel: Automatically map the employees in {{brandName}} to their corresponding records in QuickBooks Desktop based on a unique parameter.
reimbursable.defaultReimbursableAccountPayableLabel: Select the default credit account for adding
reimbursable.defaultReimbursableAccountPayableSubLabe: The integration will post the offset credit entry in

corporateCard.creditCardExpenseSubLabel: Enable this to export the corporate credit card expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any non-reimbursable expenses will not be exported to Quickbooks Desktop.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseTypeLabel: How should the expenses be exported?
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseTypeSubLabel: Choose the type of transaction in QuickBooks Desktop to export your {{brandName}} expenses.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseStateLabel: At which state should the expenses be ready to export from {{brandName}}?
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseStateSubLabel: You can export expenses either when they are awaiting closure after approval (approved) or when the expense has been closed (closed).
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseDateSubLabel: Expenses will be grouped and posted using the configured date when exporting from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseGroupLabel: How should the expenses be grouped?
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseGroupSubLabel: Expenses can either be exported as single line items (expense) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (report)
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseNameinJESubLabel: You can select either the 'merchant name' or the 'employee name' to appear in the 'name' field of your journal entries.
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountLabel: Set a default credit card account
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountSubLabel: If there's no card-to-card mapping or when an expense lacks a corporate card transaction associated with it, expenses will be posted to the default card configured here.
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountPayableLabel: Select the default credit account for adding
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountPayableSubLabel: This account will be used for the credit line of the

importSetting.contentText: In this section, you can choose the fields required to be imported from QuickBooks Desktop to {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCategoriesLabel: Import chart of accounts as categories in {{brandName}}
importSetting.importCategoriesSubLabel: Chart of accounts in QuickBooks will be imported as categories in {{brandName}}, available in a dropdown for employees to select when coding expenses.
importSetting.importItemsSubLabel: Items from QuickBooks Desktop will be imported as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.chartOfAccountTypes: Choose the type of accounts to be imported
importSetting.chartOfAccountTypesSubLabel: By default 'expense' type accounts will be imported. Open the dropdown to add or modify selections based on your needs.

advancedSettings.contentText: In this section, you can customize the integration based on your accounting requirements.
advancedSettings.automationSubLabel: You can automate the export and sync of your data in this section.
advancedSettings.customizeSectionSubLabel: In this section, you can customize the data that you'd like to export from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop.
advancedSettings.scheduleAutoExportSubLabel: Set up a schedule to frequently automate the export of expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop.
advancedSettings.autoExportfrequencySubLabel: Set a frequency based on how often you want your expenses in {{brandName}} to be exported to QuickBooks Desktop.
advancedSettings.topLevelMemoStructureSubLabel: Select the datapoints you'd like to export to QuickBooks Desktop’s top-level memo field when exporting expenses from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.memoStructureLabel: Customize the line-item level memo field
advancedSettings.memoStructureSubLabel: Select the datapoints you'd like to export to QuickBooks Desktop’s line-item level memo field when exporting expenses from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.otherPreferencesSubLabel: Based on your preference, you can choose whether you want to create any new records in QuickBooks Desktop from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsAsVendorsSubLabel: {{brandName}} will auto-create a new vendor in QuickBooks Desktop if a merchant added by an employee does not have a corresponding match in QuickBooks Desktop.
advancedSettings.skipExportLabel: Skip export of specific expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop
advancedSettings.skipExportSubLabel: Set up a conditional rule to selectively skip exporting certain expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Desktop.
advancedSettings.autoCreateReimbursableEnititySubLabel: If an employee in {{brandName}} has no corresponding record in QuickBooks Desktop, the integration will automatically create a
advancedSettings.accountingPeriodLabel: Post entries in the current accounting period
advancedSettings.accountingPeriodSubLabel: If there are expenses for which the accounting period is closed in QuickBooks Desktop, you can export those to the current month by enabling this option.

landing.contentText: Import data from NetSuite to {{brandName}} and export expenses from {{brandName}} to NetSuite.

connector.configurationSubHeaderText: Connect to the NetSuite tenant from which you would like to import and export data. The {{brandName}} org and NetSuite tenant cannot be changed once the configuration steps are complete.
connector.subLabel: Expenses will be posted to the NetSuite tenant mapping selected here. Once configured, you can not change {{brandName}} organization or tenant mapping.

exportSetting.contentText: In this section, you can configure how and when the expenses from {{brandName}} can be exported to NetSuite

corporateCard.creditCardExpenseLabel: How should the expenses be exported?
corporateCard.cccExpenseBankAccountSubLabel: The selected expense payment type will be added to the corporate credit card expenses exported from {{brandName}} to NetSuite.
corporateCard.creditCardExportTypeSubLabel: Expenses can either be exported as single line items (expense) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (report)
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseStateSubLabel: You could choose to export ccc expenses when they have been approved and are awaiting payment clearance, or simply when they have been paid out.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseStateLabel: At which state should the expenses be ready to export from {{brandName}}?
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseSubLabel: Choose the type of transaction in NetSuite to export your {{brandName}} expenses.
corporateCard.cccExpenseStateSubLabel: You can export expenses either when they're awaiting payment after approval (approved) or when the payment has been settled (closed).
corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountLabel: Set default credit card account as
corporateCard.defaultCCCVendorLabel: Set default corporate card vendor as
corporateCard.journalOptionSubLabel: You can select either the 'merchant name' or the 'employee name' to appear in the 'name' field of your journal entries.

importSetting.contentText: In this section, you can choose the fields required to be imported from NetSuite to {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCategoriesSubLabel: will be available as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCustomersSubLabel: The customers in NetSuite will be imported as projects in {{brandName}} and will be a selectable field while creating an expense
importSetting.taxCodeSubLabel: The imported tax codes from NetSuite will be set as tax group in {{brandName}}. This will be a selectable field while creating an expense
importSetting.importSuppliersAsMerchantsLabel: Import suppliers from NetSuite as merchants
importSetting.importSuppliersAsMerchantsSubLabel: The suppliers in NetSuite will be imported as merchants in {{brandName}} and will be a selectable field while creating an expense.
importSetting.notes: Note: To export billable expenses from {{brandName}}, import customers from NetSuite as projects in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.toggleToastMessage: You have already mapped a tracking category from NetSuite to the project field in {{brandName}}. Change the configured mapping to a new field to be able to import customers in the project field.
importSetting.importNetsuiteEmployeesLabel: Import NetSuite employee as employee in {{brandName}}
importSetting.importNetsuiteEmployeesSubLabel: Imported NetSuite employee will be available as employee in {{brandName}}.

advancedSettings.contentText: In this section, you can customize the integration based on your accounting requirements.
advancedSettings.paymentSyncLabel: Auto-sync payment status for reimbursable expenses
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsAsVendorsLabel: Auto create {{brandName}} merchants as contacts on NetSuite
advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountLabel: To which payment account should the payment entries be posted?
advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountSubLabel: , the payment entries will be posted to the selected payment account in
advancedSettings.postEntriesCurrentPeriod: Post entries in the next open accounting period
advancedSettings.dfvSubLabel: If you've made a field mandatory in NetSuite but don't collect a value from your employees in the expense form, you can set a default value here to be added to all the expenses. For location and department, you can opt to use the values from your employee records in NetSuite.
advancedSettings.changeAccountingPeriodSubLabel: If the accounting period in NetSuite is closed, the expenses from {{brandName}} will be exported with a date stamp of the first day next open accounting period.
advancedSettings.memoStructureLabel: Set the line item-level description field in NetSuite
advancedSettings.memoStructureSubLabel: You can choose from a list of available data points that you'd like to export to the description field in NetSuite.
advancedSettings.customizationSubLabel: In this section, you can customize the data that you'd like to export from {{brandName}} to NetSuite, you can choose what data points need to be exported and what shouldn't be.
advancedSettings.automationSubLabel: You can automate the export and sync of your data in this section.
advancedSettings.scheduleSubLabel: Set up a schedule to frequently automate the export of expenses from {{brandName}} to NetSuite.
advancedSettings.frequencySubLabel: Set a frequency based on how often you want your expenses in {{brandName}} to be exported to NetSuite.
advancedSettings.preferenceSubLabel: Based on your preference, you can choose whether you want to create any new records in NetSuite from {{brandName}}. (when there is no employee record found, or when the accounting period is closed).
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsLabel: Auto create merchant on NetSuite for credit card charge
advancedSettings.singleCreditLineJELabel: Create a single itemized offset credit entry for journal
advancedSettings.singleCreditLineJESubLabel: Merge all credits in a journal to create a single entry.

landing.contentText: Import data from Xero to {{brandName}} and export expenses from {{brandName}} to Xero.

connector.configurationSubHeaderText: Connect to the Xero tenant from which you would like to import and export data. The {{brandName}} org and Xero tenant cannot be changed once the configuration steps are complete.
connector.subLabel: Expenses will be posted to the Xero tenant mapping selected here. Once configured, you can not change {{brandName}} organization or tenant mapping.

exportSetting.contentText: Enable this to export non-reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any corporate credit card expenses will not be exported to Xero.

corporateCard.cccExpenseBankAccountSubLabel: The selected expense payment type will be added to the corporate credit card expenses exported from {{brandName}} to Xero.
corporateCard.cccExpenseBankAccountLabel: To which bank account should the bank transactions be posted to?
corporateCard.cccExpenseStateSubLabel: You can export expenses either when they're awaiting payment after approval (approved) or when the payment has been settled (closed).

exportSetting.cccExpenseStateLabel: At which state should the expenses be ready to export from {{brandName}}?
exportSetting.stepSubLabel: In this section, you will configure how and when expenses from {{brandName}} can be exported to Xero.

importSetting.contentText: In this section, you can choose the fields required to be imported from Xero to {{brandName}}
importSetting.importCategoriesLabel: Import the chart of accounts as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCategoriesSubLabel: Imported account will be available as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importCustomersSubLabel: The customers in Xero will be imported as projects in {{brandName}} and will be a selectable field while creating an expense
importSetting.taxCodeSubLabel: The imported tax codes from Xero will be set as tax group in
importSetting.importSuppliersAsMerchantsLabel: Import suppliers from Xero as merchants
importSetting.importSuppliersAsMerchantsSubLabel: The suppliers in Xero will be imported as merchants in {{brandName}} and will be a selectable field while creating an expense.
importSetting.notes: Note: To export billable expenses from {{brandName}}, import customers from Xero as projects in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.toggleToastMessage: You have already mapped a tracking category from Xero to the project field in {{brandName}}. Change the configured mapping to a new field to be able to import customers in the project field.
importSetting.chartOfAccountsLabel: Select the accounts from Xero to import as categories in{{brandName}}
importSetting.chartOfAccountsSubLabel: By default expense will be selected. Open the dropdown to select more as per your requirements.

advancedSettings.paymentSyncLabel: Auto-sync payment status for reimbursable expenses
advancedSettings.autoCreateMerchantsAsVendorsLabel: Auto create {{brandName}} merchants as contacts on Xero
advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountLabel: To which payment account should the payment entries be posted?
advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountSubLabel: , the payment entries will be posted to the selected payment account in
advancedSettings.postEntriesCurrentPeriod: Post entries in the current accounting period
advancedSettings.contentText: In this section, you can customize the integration based on your accounting requirements.
advancedSettings.topLevelMemoStructureSubLabel: Select the datapoints you'd like to export to Xero’s top-level memo field when exporting expenses from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.memoStructureLabel: Customize the line-item level memo field
advancedSettings.memoStructureSubLabel: Select the datapoints you'd like to export to Xero’s line-item level memo field when exporting expenses from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.customizeSectionSubLabel: In this section, you can customize the data that you'd like to export from {{brandName}} to Xero. You can choose what data points need to be exported and what shouldn't be.
advancedSettings.frequencySubLabel: Set a frequency based on how often you want your expenses in {{brandName}} to be exported to Xero.
advancedSettings.customPreferencesSubLabel: Based on your preference, you can choose whether you want to create any new records in Xero from {{brandName}}. (when there is no employee record found, or when the accounting period is closed)
advancedSettings.automationSubLabel: You can automate the export and sync of your data in this section.
advancedSettings.scheduleSubLabel: Set up a schedule to frequently automate the export of expenses from {{brandName}} to Xero.
advancedSettings.accountingPeriodSubLabel: If there are expenses for which the accounting period is closed in Xero, you can export those to the current month by enabling this option.
advancedSettings.autoCreateVendorsSubLabel: While exporting reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}, the integration will automatically create a vendor if a match does not exist in Xero already

landing.contentText: Import data from Sage Intacct to {{brandName}} and export expenses from {{brandName}} to Sage Intacct.

connector.locationSubLabel: Expenses will be posted to the Sage Intacct location entity selected here. Once configured, you can not change {{brandName}} organization or location entity.
connector.subLabel: To connect your {{brandName}} and Sage Intacct account, follow the detailed instructions provided in the article to generate the credentials and establish a secure connection.
connector.connectorInfoLabel: Please use the integration credentials you received via email. These are different from the ones you use to login to your Sage Intacct account.

exportSetting.contentText: Enable this to export non-reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any corporate credit card expenses will not be exported to Sage Intacct.

corporateCard.cccExpensePaymentType: Set the default expense payment type as?
corporateCard.cccExpensePaymentTypeSubLabel: The selected expense payment type will be added to the corporate credit card expenses exported from {{brandName}} to Sage Intacct.
corporateCard.creditCardVendor: Set the default credit card vendor as
corporateCard.creditCardVendorSublabel: The vendor configured here will be added to all the credit card expenses exported as bills.
corporateCard.chargeCardSublabel: Expenses of corporate cards in {{brandName}} that are not mapped to their respective cards in Sage Intacct will be posted to the card configured here. You can map your cards in the mapping section after configuring the integration.
corporateCard.cccExpenseState: You can export expenses either when they are awaiting closure after approval (approved) or when the transactions has been settled (closed)
corporateCard.cccExportGroup: Expenses can either be exported as single line items (expense) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (report)
corporateCard.employeeFieldMapping: How are your employees represented in Sage Intacct?
corporateCard.creditCard: To which general ledger account should the expenses be credited to?
corporateCard.creditCardSubLabel: The integration will credit the account selected here for corporate credit card expenses exported as journal entries.

advancedSettings.contentText: In this section, you can customize the integration based on your accounting requirements.
advancedSettings.autoSyncPayments: Auto-sync payment status for reimbursable expenses
advancedSettings.postEntriesCurrentPeriod: Post entries in the current accounting period
advancedSettings.setDescriptionField: Customize the line-item level memo field
advancedSettings.topMemoStructureSubLabel: Select the datapoints you'd like to export to Sage Intacct's top-level description field when exporting expenses from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.dfvSubLabel: If you've made a field mandatory in Sage Intacct but don't collect a value from your employees in the expense form, you can set a default value here to be added to all the expenses. For location and department, you can opt to use the values from your employee records in Sage Intacct.
advancedSettings.frequencySubLabel: Set a frequency based on how often you want your expenses in {{brandName}} to be exported to Sage Intacct.
advancedSettings.customPreferencesSubLabel: Based on your preference, you can choose whether you want to create any new records in Sage Intacct from {{brandName}}. (when there is no employee record found, or when the accounting period is closed)
advancedSettings.automationSubLabel: You can automate the export and sync of your data in this section.
advancedSettings.scheduleSubLabel: Set up a schedule to frequently automate the export of expenses from {{brandName}} to Sage Intacct.
advancedSettings.accountingPeriodSubLabel: If there are expenses for which the accounting period is closed in Sage Intacct, you can export those to the current month by enabling this option.
advancedSettings.memoStructureSubLabel: Select the datapoints you'd like to export to Sage Intacct's line-item level memo field when exporting expenses from {{brandName}}.
advancedSettings.customizeSectionSubLabel: In this section, you can customize the data that you'd like to export from {{brandName}} to Sage Intacct. You can choose what data points need to be exported and what shouldn't be.

exportSetting.contentText: In this section, you will configure how and when expenses from {{brandName}} can be exported to QuickBooks Online.

corporateCard.defaultCCCAccountLabel: Set default credit card account as
corporateCard.defaultCCCVendorLabel: Set default corporate card vendor as
corporateCard.defaultCCCVendorSubLabel: This selected vendor will be applied on all corporate card transactions exported to QuickBooks Online.
corporateCard.accountsPayableLabel: To which accounts payable account should the
corporateCard.accountsPayableSubLabel: to the selected accounts payable account.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseSubLabel: You could choose to export ccc expenses when they have been approved and are awaiting payment clearance, or simply when they have been paid out.
corporateCard.creditCardExportGroupSubLabel: Expense can either be exported as single line items (expense) or as a grouped report with multiple line items (expense report).
corporateCard.journalOptionSubLabel: You can select either the 'merchant name' or the 'employee name' to appear in the 'name' field of your journal entries.
corporateCard.creditCardExpenseLabel: At which state should the expenses be ready to export from {{brandName}}?
corporateCard.creditCardExportTypeSubLabel: Choose the type of transaction in QuickBooks Online to export your {{brandName}} expenses.

importSetting.importCategoriesLabel: Import the chart of accounts as categories in {{brandName}}
importSetting.importCategoriesSubLabel: Imported account will be available as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.importItemsSubLabel: Products/services from QuickBooks Online will be imported as categories in {{brandName}}.
importSetting.taxCodeSubLabel: The imported tax codes from QuickBooks Online will be set as tax group in
importSetting.chartOfAccountTypes: Select the accounts from QuickBooks to import as categories in {{brandName}}
importSetting.chartOfAccountTypesSubLabel: By default expense will be selected. Open the dropdown to select more as per your requirements.

advancedSettings.billPaymentAccountSubLabel: , the payment entries will be posted to the selected payment account in

advancedSettings.scheduleSubLabel: Set up a schedule to frequently automate the export of expenses from {{brandName}} to QuickBooks Online.

done.hintText: After launching the integration, you can change your settings at any point of time under the configuration section.
done.doneHeaderText: Your integration setup is now complete.

dashboard.exportLogSubHeader: These expenses have failed to export due to some errors. Resolve the errors on your dashboard to and try to re-export them again

exportLog.searchPlaceholder: Search by employee name or expense ID
exportLog.completeExportLogZeroStateSubHeaderText: We could not find what you were looking for. Kindly check the keywords again.
exportLog.completeExportLogCountZeroStateSubHeader: All your successful exports and their details will be stored here.
exportLog.skipExportLogZeroStateSubHeaderText: We could not find what you were looking for. Kindly check the keywords again.
